ARABIC: كَلَّآ إِذَا دُكَّتِ ٱلْأَرْضُ دَكًّا دَكًّا

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: No indeed! When the earth is crushed and ground to dust
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Surely when We pound the earth to powder grounded, pounded to dust,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: But no; when the earth is ground to powder,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: When the earth is crushed into small pieces
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Most certainly – when the earth is smashed and blown to bits.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Nay! When the earth is flatened, Dakkan Dakka.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Nay! when the earth is made to crumble to pieces,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: No indeed! When the earth is ground to powder,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Nay, but when the earth is ground to atoms, grinding, grinding,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: No indeed! When the earth is crushed and ground to dust,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: By no means! when the earth shall be ground with grinding, grinding,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: No indeed! When the earth is levelled to a plain,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Nay! When the earth is pounded to powder,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Nay! When the earth is ground to powder,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: No! But when the earth quakes and is pounded,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: No—when the earth is leveled, pounded, and crushed.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: No! When the earth has been leveled - pounded and crushed -
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [89:21] No indeed! — a deterrent for them from such [conduct]. When the earth is pulverised repeatedly, when it is shaken until every edifice has collapsed and is destroyed,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: Nay) this is also a reply to them, (but when the earth is ground to atoms, grinding, grinding) He says: when the earth is quaked again and again,
